page.title: 19Interview with Mr Coltart
page.content: Mr Coltart has been farming for 40 years. He lives alone at Wheatcroft Farm. There are a few cottages about Wheatcroft. Mr Coltart has no workers on the farm. He did have one but not now. If he needs any help he gets a man from one of the cottages. He starts work at 6.30 am and finishes at 5.30 pm. He has 20 cows and about 30 calves. He has no sheep. He does not milk the cows. He just lets the calves milk them. Over the past 20 to 30 years he said there has not been much change. Two or three years ago he had a bull but he has sold it. Tony Coltart thinks his farm will be the same for another 10 or 20 years.
